page.title: 02Nantwich People
page.content: Anyone born and bred in Nantwich is called a Dabber.This name comes from a tool used by workers in the local shoe factories,according to local history. Today,many local people work out of the town but they do use Nantwich shops regularly.The original{black and {white buildings,}sandstone church and wealth of history,make Nantwich a centre for tourism.Recently a{town {crier}has been employed to walk round the town and read aloud local news and events. Residents consider the local councillors and vicars to be leading members of their community and feel their town has a warm,friendly atmosphere. A young resident became famous in the 1970's when he swam the{English {Channel}at the age of 17.A plaque in the local pool commemorates the swim.
